com.facebook.litho.widget

Interface Binder<V extends ViewGroup>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    RecyclerBinder, SectionBinderTarget

    public interface Binder<V extends ViewGroup>
    This binder class is used to asynchronously layout Components given a list of Component and attaching them to a ViewGroup through the bind(ViewGroup) method.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void bind(V view)
      Bind this Binder to a View.
      boolean canMeasure()
      Only for horizontally scrolling layouts: return true if height is not known when measuring the view and the first item will be measured to determine the height.
      void detach()
      Detach items under the hood.
      ComponentTree getComponentAt(int position)
      Returns the component at the given position in the binder.
      boolean isWrapContent()
      Return true if wrap content is enabled, false otherwise.
      void measure(Size outSize, int widthSpec, int heightSpec, EventHandler<ReMeasureEvent> reMeasureEventHandler)
      Measure the content of this Binder.
      void mount(V view)
      Call this method before the View is mounted, i.e.
      void setCanMeasure(boolean canMeasure)
      Only for horizontally scrolling layouts: set to true if height is not known when measuring the view and the first item will need to be measured to determine the height of the view.
      void setSize(int width, int height)
      Set the width and height of the View that will be passed to the subsequent mount(ViewGroup), bind(ViewGroup) and unmount(ViewGroup) calls.
      void setViewportChangedListener(ViewportInfo.ViewportChanged viewportChangedListener)
      Bind a ViewportInfo.ViewportChanged listener to this Binder.
      void unbind(V view)
      Call this method when the view is unbound.
      void unmount(V view)
      Call this method when the view is unmounted.

    • Method Detail

      • setSize

        void setSize(int width,
             int height)
        Set the width and height of the View that will be passed to the subsequent mount(ViewGroup), bind(ViewGroup) and unmount(ViewGroup) calls. Can be called by any thread.
        Parameters:
        width - Usually the view width minus horizontal padding.
        height - Usually the view height minus vertical padding.

      • measure

        void measure(Size outSize,
             int widthSpec,
             int heightSpec,
             EventHandler<ReMeasureEvent> reMeasureEventHandler)
        Measure the content of this Binder. Call this method from the Component's onMeasure.

      • getComponentAt

        ComponentTree getComponentAt(int position)
        Returns the component at the given position in the binder.

      • mount

        void mount(V view)
        Call this method before the View is mounted, i.e. within ComponentLifecycle.onMount(ComponentContext, Object))}

      • bind

        void bind(V view)
        Bind this Binder to a View. Remember to call ViewGroup#notifyDataSetChanged() when your Components are ready to be used.

      • unbind

        void unbind(V view)
        Call this method when the view is unbound.
        Parameters:
        view - the view being unbound.

      • unmount

        void unmount(V view)
        Call this method when the view is unmounted.
        Parameters:
        view - the view being unmounted.

      • setViewportChangedListener

        void setViewportChangedListener(ViewportInfo.ViewportChanged viewportChangedListener)
        Bind a ViewportInfo.ViewportChanged listener to this Binder. The listener will be notified of Viewport changes.
        Parameters:
        viewportChangedListener -

      • isWrapContent

        boolean isWrapContent()
        Return true if wrap content is enabled, false otherwise.

      • canMeasure

        boolean canMeasure()
        Only for horizontally scrolling layouts: return true if height is not known when measuring the view and the first item will be measured to determine the height.

      • setCanMeasure

        void setCanMeasure(boolean canMeasure)
        Only for horizontally scrolling layouts: set to true if height is not known when measuring the view and the first item will need to be measured to determine the height of the view.

      • detach

        void detach()
        Detach items under the hood.
